author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are uppercase.
- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- The compat entry for `julia` is unbounded.
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: PyCall
- I was not able to load the package (i.e. `import EE` failed). See the CI logs for details.
- Package name similar to 13 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to GR. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  2. Similar to Z3. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  3. Similar to H3. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to ECC. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to EDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to Tk. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to BED. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to JET. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to PEG. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to AES. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to NES. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  12. Similar to ODE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  13. Similar to ASE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

  </details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

This package, EE, wraps the Python earthengine-api package (https://github.com/google/earthengine-api/tree/master/python). 

Here is info to address the auto merge issues:
* I  added in the compat entries to the Project.toml file with the latest pull request.
* The common way the community abbreviates the package is `ee`. This Julia package uses the short name "EE" as the abbreviation and capitalized to differentiate from the Python API.
* I think the package failed to load because it depends on the Python package and I am not sure how to do an automated install through Julia package manager. I provide documentation on how to install the Python dependency [here](https://github.com/KMarkert/EE.jl#installation)

Please let me know if more information is need to have this package registered.
Can we have a less cryptic name though?  It's hard to guess what EE stands for

Sure, I understand how that may be confusion.  I renamed the package to "EarthEngine" (https://github.com/KMarkert/EarthEngine.jl/blob/main/src/EarthEngine.jl#L3). 

How should we proceed? Do I trigger a new registry pull request?

> How should we proceed? Do I trigger a new registry pull request?

Yes please!
